result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam James St Louis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
DV assessment imposed.
DNA surcharge and DV assessment are due by 10/24/2024. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
All other court costs, fines and surcharges are waived due to inability to pay.

The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

charges.descr: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam James St Louis

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Adam James St Louis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Adam James St Louis.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1, 3, AND 5 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 4, AND 6: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction; concurrent.  

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction; concurrent.  

AS TO COUNT 6: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction; concurrent.  

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- DV assessment imposed.
- All other court costs, fines, and surcharges are WAIVED due to inability to pay. 
- DNA surcharge and DV assessment are due by: 10/24/2024. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply and any remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

*The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Adam James St Louis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Adam James St Louis.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Plea/Sentencing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons discussed off the record. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Adam James St Louis not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery but needs an offer from the State. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Adam James St Louis in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam James St Louis in court, defendant in custody with attorney Matthew V Plummer. Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing upon release of VOP hold.

Court ordered no contact with ANL (5/16/1994)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Adam James St Louis in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Adam James St Louis in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adam James St Louis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
